answers.answer: The Immigration Service for the Cluj County can be contacted via email at cj.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0264 555 656 and 0264 432 727.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: To apply for the support program for accommodation, meals, and integration, one needs to access the application.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Cluj-Napoca'.

answers.answer: For medical services, individuals can contact the Clinical Emergency Hospital in Napoca Cluj.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Individuals can receive psychological support by contacting Boanca Simona at IOM via sboanca@iom.int or +40745016883, or George Macarie at World Vision Romania via george_macarie@wvi.org or +40742077901.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The Sensiblu Foundation offers social counseling, psychotherapy, legal advice and representation in court, a support network for women and girls, forensic medical certificates, and referral to mediation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: PATRIR's 'Ukrainian Home - Protection and Support Center' assists refugees by protecting, providing information, fostering well-being and inclusiveness through Protection Support Centers, psychosocial support, injury assistance, and verified information.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Public transportation in Cluj can be used for free, but users must show an ID if checked.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Transport'.

answers.answer: Women can access support for reproductive health services, navigating the health system, or services for victims of domestic violence by clicking the provided link under the Women's Center section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV in Romania can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers and support from Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.

answers.answer: Psychological assistance services are offered in Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The provided content does not specify the exact conditions or times when one can contact the National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania, only the contact numbers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Important contacts'.
